description:
More than A-OK, we'll be back...

Assumption: This is a Chinese run Japanese ramen joint so we didn't expect it to be authentic.

Context: Me, wife, and kid on a lazy Sunday late afternoon and wanted some ramen. A quick yelp search using "black garlic ramen" returned this so here we came without knowing any details. 

Ordered: Tonkotsu black mild spicy and katsu egg don. We're too hungry that we placed our order with little attention to the costs.

The place: I don't think it's been around for too long but it gave me the hole-in-the-wall kinda feel. Deco? what deco? Service was pretty good tho. Parking could be a problem, it's all by luck.

The meal: 
 - The don came out first and the portion is BIG. I found long grain rice, that's a let down. But the pork and the sauce saved it. 

 - The ramen is BIG too in portion size. Meat to noodles ratio is ridiculous in terms of ramen, about 3/1. I liked all the meats and the eggs but the noodles are like... packaged? I love garlic and the broth is super garlicy, loved it!
author: Rio T.

description:
Big ass portions for a great price. 

No wait time. Friendly service.

If you like a meaty ramen bowl with lots of noodles to spare, come here!

The broth is kinda heavy. I ordered medium spicy, not spicy at all. Maybe increase the spice of what you usually order.

I prefer Ramen Parlor in sm. Don't be deterred by the wait time warnings. Come right around the time they open 11am in the morning and 5pm in the afternoon. A line is formed, but everyone gets inside and the food comes out fairly quickly. I never wait more than 10 minutes or so.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
5:30 Tuesday night party of four. Metered parking and some residential parking available nearby. 
It was empty until we arrived so service was understandably very attentive. Our server was actually very thoughtful, suggesting entrees that would most likely please my very particular( and rightfully so for 80+ years young) mother. 
So many options on the menu as well as levels of spiciness. 
Ordered Agedashi Tofu- batter is different than the norm, almost like a salt and pepper crust without the flavor. Still delicious. 

Lobster black garlic ramen with roasted pork, pork shoulder - special ramens come with 1/2 soft shell crab, snow crab, 1/2 soft boiled egg ground pork seasonal veggies and a quail egg-**wow** smoky and rich. Some of the cuts of pork melted in my mouth -yum! Loved the cabbage and wished there was more. 
 (hold the mushrooms)

Miso corn ramen- comes with pork 1/2 soft boiled egg, quail egg and veggies. - daughter finished her bowl and said would order again

Tan tan ramen combo(spicy) with roast pork and pork belly (hold the mushrooms)-served was so nice to keep refilling his water. It was hot! But tasty so he said. 

Unagi Don- tender and flavorful. Nicely dressed salad balance the meal. 

I'm guessing this place is much busier in the day. Each time we've come for dinner it was typically empty for the most part of the evening. 
Hidden gem.
author: Elaine S.

description:
SO MANY NOODLES

Located across from San Francisco's Community College, this is the go to spot for hungry students. It's on the bustling part of Ocean Avenue so parking might be a challenge, but there's plenty along the side street a block away. Right near the hub for a bunch of public transit though.

This is hole in the wall type spot! Limited seating and I wouldn't advise going with a group more than 4. 

I ordered the Miso with Chicken and it was SO DELICIOUS. It was topped with the traditional black cabbage, soft egg, and corn. The portions and flavors were plentiful! Will definitely be returning here. Their lunch special made my soup 12 dollars!

Something to note, though, is that they have a credit minimum of 15 dollars.
author: Navila H.

description: This is a great Ramen place that does not cost you a lot of money like others in San Francisco. On top of the delicious creamy Ramen noodles, every dish here has also served with big portion. I'll definitely come back. It's also my favorite Ramen place now.
author: Kevin L.

description: Great portion and excellent price. House specialty ramen was awesome. Thick pork slices,  soup was perfect not salty.  Definitely recommend.  The waitress was super waitress.  Handles the whole restaurant and didn't wait for anything...
author: John S.

description: So this place is a little hidden, but well worth the hunt. My companion and I decided to try the kimchi which was really good, but it said it came with fruit too which it did not. Maybe they ran out. We got the spiced miso ramen and mild spice tankatsu ramen. They were both very good and huge. I'm looking forward to going back!
author: Julianne O.

description:
Updated: 9/21/18

I felt disappointed this time. I always have good impression and good experience with this place but not today. I ordered two lunch specials and one unagi don. The unagi tasted like rubber. Not even a knife can cut through it. I have to pointed it out and the staff said sorry must be the cook over cooked the unagi and nicely offer to make me another one or make another dish for me. I ordered another fish dish and still didn't taste good. The other fish ramen didn't taste great either. The noodle was under cooked and the fish ramen didn't taste good either.  I have to drop two stars this time and hopefully next time if I come back will see some improvements.
author: Diane T.

description:
What did I have, Yelp! asks? 
The best Ramen to date! (Aside from what I remember eating as a kid in Japan. But that's +20 years ago... and in Japan.) What's not to like? The delicious broth, the other flavors from the ground pork... or softshell crab anyone? C'mon, this is awesome! (And, I don't say that too much.)
author: ben c.

description: I really want to support this business. The staff is great and in many ways, the food is very good too. For example, the meat is high quality. The spinach is super fresh as are the mushrooms. The noodles are also good. But, it is way, way, way TOO SALTY. Please reduce your salt. I'd love to come back.
author: Katie T.

description:
This place has a decent variety of Japanese  food. They have all the basics and more. I really didn't have a super special experience here but it clearly satisfied my ramen cravings. The portion feels a bit bigger than average. 

Warning, don't get the curry tonkatsu because it is mostly katsu and like no curry. 

Cheaper than other ramen houses and chill. Street parking isn't too hard to find (I parked 1 block over).  They also feature daily specials so im satisfied as well.
author: Na X.

description: Delicious food, conscious meat and veg choices, reasonable prices! My daughter and I will be back soon.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
The special at the back of the menu is a ton of food for 12$. Both is deep and creamy 

4 different types of pork and they dont fuck around with portions
author: Alex D.

description:
Fire. Just fire. Relatively cheap and HUGE portions! 

Go for the Black Garlic Ramen, spicy! You won't regret it. The gyozas were perfectly fried and scrumptious!
author: Carlos R.

description: Very large portion!  I had the ribs in my ramen, it was tender and delicious.  The broth is not the best I've ever had, but it's not bad.  I mean, there wasn't a wait time on a Friday night, so I much rather eat here than waiting 1-2 hours at some really popular ramen place.
author: Bobby G.

description: I used to hate ramen but this place was amazing!! I forgot which one I ordered but I think I got the specialty ramen with lobster chili oil. The server was super sweet too!
author: Theresa S.

description:
I'm a fan. Granted I don't stray too much from the regular items.

Sweet waitress. Usually not super busy even though it's by City College.
When there, I go with the house ramen because it comes with a order of Gyoza as part as the house special. My boyfriend has tried the Tan Tan ramen which he felt was spicy and he has a pretty high threshold, so maybe go more mild. and FYI, broth has peanuts so if allergic stay away.
We've also ate the spicy kimchi fried rice which is actually really good, great flavor. decent portions. Surprisingly good.
We definitely frequent this place. Prices are reasonable, little to no wait and food is always consistent.
Parking can be difficult. That would be my only negative.
author: francis c.

description: Honestly this spot is for sure a hidden gem! Was on the hunt and craving for some good ramen and stumbled upon this place on yelp. Looked pretty good so me and my friend decided to give it a try. I ordered the black garlic lobster ramen that included soft shell crab in it too. Sooooo good!!! Their portions are big and will definitely fill you up. Delicious taste and worth every penny. Also, no wait! I love going to other ramen places like ramen parlor and ramen dojo in San Mateo, but there's always a long wait until you get seated. This spot is 100% a must try! Highly highly recommend
author: Monica-Leah A.

description:
This spot has decent ramen for a great price. 

Appetizers: we tried the takoyaki and karaage. The taste was good, but they were gooey on the inside so either too much batter or it wasn't cooked long enough. 

Entree: I tried the special, a spicy miso ramen. Broth had an excellent flavor and had just a mild kick of spice. Soft boiled egg was cooked properly and the noodles had a decent texture. Extra noodles for a couple bucks was definitely worth it. 

The service is passable, portions are good and prices are great. 

Food: 3.75/5
Value: 4.25/5
Service: 3.75/5
Overall: 3.75/5
author: Brian G.

description:
3.5 for neighborhood ramen spot. I would say this place is above average compared some local spots.
I still like my Japanese ramen joint in SM. It's not the same imo.
author: Larry L.

description:
Ignored the inaccurate operational hrs posted at the door.  Sometimes they open Sat and closed on Sun and vise versa.  I'm no expert but after different Ramen experience at other places, I'm more in love with my original spot.  Yes, 21 is my first ramen and continue to Wow me.
I usually get the house special Tonkatsu with 1/2 soft shell crab.  There's always a lot of goodies in it like lots of seaweed, quail egg, pork belly, so there's no need to asks for add-on items.  Noodle is cooked to perfect al dente, portion size is great.  Order large is enough for 2 people.  I prefer not spicy because I want to taste the sweetness of the milky bone soup. I've been coming here since they open and hope to return many times.
author: Mar H.

description: My my my. What a delicious surprise! Will be back. Yummmmmmmmm! We WILL be back. Thank tou
author: C U.

description: I always have lunch at the weird time like 3 or 4 pm so I'm so happy to have wandered into this ramen house! Decent ramen with generous portion but reasonable price! Friendly staffs also. TBH I was skeptical as I saw no one inside when i opened the door. Glad I didn't leave!
author: Ada L.

description:
If you are hungry and want a big plate of food to eat, come here!

This is one of those places that offer good quantity of food for the price you pay. I have no complaints about that. I think a lot of college students would appreciate this since City college is just a couple blocks away. 

For me, my experience here was okay. I got a chicken katsu rice plate. The portion was so big that I could share with my boyfriend and at the end we were both very full. But the quality of the food is not that high quality. It gives me the feel that it's something I can easily make at home. However I appreciate the price I paid for the portions I have gotten. 

So I would recommend to anyone who is really hungry and really want something quick to eat. *thumbs up*
author: Joanne C.

description:
Very good and authentic ramen. I tried their spicy ramen with pork and it was delightful. We also did their fried octopus balls which were ok as was their seaweed salad. 

I would definitely go back there again as prices are super reasonable and their noodles are great and the broth is packed with flavor.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Overall rating: 3.75/5
Parking: It's located on Ocean so parking can be kinda difficult since the Muni train runs by here there's less parking on the street.
Best time to go: Probably during lunch time. I haven't tried dinner time rush yet

There are a lot of mixed reviews for this place but I decided to give it a try anyway. It's true that this is definitely NOT an authentic Japanese spot. You can tell the difference in the broth between authentic Japanese and probably a Chinese owned spot but I reviewed this place based on flavor.

I came on a Sunday afternoon for lunch around 1pm and the restaurant was nearly full. The decor is kinda like what you would expect a Chinese restaurant to be but it's clean enough and that's all I care about.

Service was nice and she was friendly. There was only one waitress who sits in the corner near the front door. She was attentive and took our orders quick.

I ordered the Tan Tan Ramen Combo - $11 (Rating: 4/5)
The amount of flavor and the texture of the noodles are good enough to satisfy my ramen craving even though as I mentioned before, it's definitely not an authentic ramen spot. The meats and broth were really tasty and had lots of flavor. I came here not expecting much but I was shocked at how much I enjoyed it.

Crispy Octopus Balls (Takoyaki) - $5.95 for 8 pieces (Rating: 3.75/5)
Piping hot and fresh! 8 pieces for $5.95? I consider that a pretty good deal in the city. The filling was nice and creamy and had at least 2 pieces of octopus in there. Nicely crunchy and topped with bonito flakes that were still moving.

My boyfriend ordered the Original Lobster Tonkatsu Ramen $10.75. It comes with lobster, roasted pork, pork shoulder meat, kikurage mushrooms, a little crab, half a seasoned soft-boiled egg, quail eggs, spinach, etc. He said it was good but not great. I tasted the broth and the broth was pretty tasty. You can kinda tell the seafood isn't completely fresh. I don't recommend getting this if you can get itchy from non-fresh seafood.

For the price, I think it's a good spot if you just need a simple ramen fix that's tasty. If you're looking for the authentic stuff and not a knock-off, don't come here.
author: Valerie T.

description:
The service is great.

Food taste okay, but the portion is huge! The price is cheap, so definitely can't complain.

I am giving this place a 4 stars because the place feels really dirty and stuffy. The tables and color of the insides make you not want to touch any part of it.
author: Jason C.

description: Well deserve my try.. and my bills. But it's not easy to get parking. Great fried shrimps tempura and fried chicken wings and ramen. Great customer service.
author: Heather K.

description:
Small but cozy, service is good soup was good.
Soup has flavor busy during school time
author: Nicey S.

description:
Worst ramen spot I have ever been to. Food was disgusting. Why does the enoki and spinach come uncook? What happened to my soup?

It's by City College so I'm assuming they get business from college kids. Prices are decent which is why fellow yelpers would come here. But the ramen was disgusting and it came with very little soup. See picture. 

Service was not great either. There was only one waitress. I told her the ramen wasn't good and there was barely any soup. She could care less. I had to ask for a bowl of soup. No apology or anything whatsoever. She also asked customers who weren't Asian, if the food was ok or if they needed anything. But she never asked the Asian customers at other tables. Rude. 

Rather cook a ramen at home.
author: Tammy F.

description: Tokyo style Tan Tan ramen pictured. Like a party in bowl. Basically a whole pig was sacrificed for this ramen. Lunch specials are a great deal, especially since this is so close to CCSF. Most items for under $10
author: Khai T.

description: Exceeded my expectations for sure!! Food was delicious and service was great. This little hole in the wall should not be missed!!
author: Ximena L.

description:
Wonderful hidden Ramen gem in my neighborhood! 
I had seen this Ramen house before and thought they had a huge ass variety of Ramen. They also have some really cool appetizers like the special house wings.
Ever since I tried them, I can say that they are the most amazing spices you will ever try! Ramen is super authentic really great flavors and the prices are super! 
I had a special made for me which was on the old menu... Spicy Chicken nugget Ramen ;) this one is made with the pork  broth. I think this is my favorite now.
author: Tere C.

description:
Food is good and price isn't that expensive! Ramen ranges from $9-15. Decent ramen place. All my friends whom I brought here never had complaints. They all love their ramen. Oh they have tsukemen too! Obviously you can't compare this place to ramen dojo but if you want a quick fix of good ramen and not too expensive, this is the place. They offer other dishes other than ramen as well.

And I almost didn't want to write a review because I'm afraid this little gem would be discovered by people and be popular :/

Service is great! The lady who is at the cashier was prompt in seating us (sometimes when she is handling a customer, she always notice people who walk into the door), giving us menus, taking orders, serving water, bringing out orders and refilling waters! She was the only server and even when the whole restaurant (about 6-8 tables) was occupied, her service was still much better than any other chinese/asian reataurant I've been to.
author: Inez J.

description: Had their really tasty medium-spicy tonkatsu! Huge portions. Friendly waitress. $28+tip for two people for just ramen, so price does reflect the size. Food came out very fast
author: Katherine G.

description:
TLDR:
Food - decent / not bad
Service - mehs: didn't get our orders right

The ramen was just okay. I liked that there were a bunch of toppings and different veggies, but the flavor of the broth was so-so. 

The waitress didn't get my boyfriend's exact order correctly. Additionally, my ramen was supposed to be "medium spicy", however it came out not the teensy bit spicy.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
The home made tonkatsu was delish and portion quite large but maybe ask for the crab on the side so it doesn't get soggy. The pork belly was really tender, partner got the short ribs meat was super soft and flavorful but with a lot of tendon which I Iike but he doesn't.

Tables and entire atmosphere could use an upgrade but staff was nice and I liked the food.
author: Patricia L.

description: Ramen is perfect. My favorite ramen house. Not too expensive and good taste. The owner is very nice. Absolutely love this place.
author: Pat W.

description: Found a fucking crockroach in the food. They did not charge, but I will never come back to this place.
author: Anthony C.

description:
Dan Dan Rame taste good! Also you can choose whether you want it spicy! 
It's hard to found parking around here.
author: Xianglin W.

description: This review is for the food itself. The service is good. I used to order the seafood ramen when I go to this place and it was really good but now they took that off their menu. I had to order the teriyaki chicken and gyoza. The teriyaki chickens was so bland and had a lot of water on the plate. The gyoza dumplings were so burnt. I won't be coming back to this place anymore.
author: Anonymous B.

description:
Miso Ramen, too salty to eat, with no bean sprouts or green onion! Just a bunch of corn. 

Gyoza, not pan fried gyoza at all but deep fried potstickers. 

Disgusting experience.
author: Texus T.

description: Sunday 130p. Not busy. Got the super spicy tonkatsu ramen. Soft shell crab. Shredded lobster. Pork with fat. Quail egg. Soft boiled egg. Cabbage. Kimchi. Spinish. It was good. Spicy. But not overly. I wouldn't say super spicy but I was glad it wasn't too hot. Nice service. Decor could be updated.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Underrated little ramen spot. It's one of my favorite places to get my ramen fix!! I always order the homemade spicy tankatsu ramen, so yummy, and affordable!
author: Genesis E.

description: Very cosy place ! Perfect spot to have lunch/dinner before or after classes ! They gave WiFi which is a big plus ! And their Roman was one of the most yummy I've tried !
author: Vadzim S.

description: This ramen shop is very delicious and is worth paying for the amount you get. Their ramen ranges from $11-$14 which is very affordable and they always come in a big bowl. Most ramen shops in the city are expensive and it's a gamble sometimes paying $15 to try a new spot. Another great feature about this place is that they always have a special. Sometimes you'll get lucky and pay $11 for miso ramen with gyoza, that's a total steal!
author: Helen Y.

description: This is the best ramen house that everyone should give a try! Their lobster ramen is very unique, really good and tasty. Their classic ramen is also very delicious and satisfying. Serving size is also way good for the price. This place is not noticeable and parking is difficult. We parked at Whole Foods for 90 minuets then went grocery shopping after. :)
author: Glenda G.

description: Best Ramen in town ! The classic ramen was amazing. The broth was very tasteful and the noodle were cooked perfectly.
author: Fatima G.

description: I've been to over 15 restaurants in San Francisco to eat ramen and they don't even compare to the ramen they serve in this place. They give you a lot of everything in their bowls. It comes with a great amount of noodles, veggies, and meat. I guarantee that their ramen will fill you up and that you'd leave wanting to come back and try all their other ramen choices. this is the place to get ramen they're the best place in San Francisco.
author: Fernando A.

description: Surprising me this place is GEM ! I thought just like regular cheap ramen wannabe but this place actually taste very good ! probably the best ramen in San Francisco. Almost same taste with Dojo Ramen in San Mateo. Get Garlic Tonkatsu Ramen !
author: Steven L.

description: Visited my boyfriend and friend at school for a quick lunch on my day off. Didn't know much restaurants around and found this place, wasn't too thrilled compared to them because they are ramen fans and I'm not. Even though I'm not a big ramen fan, I must say that this place is pretty good! I am a big fan of their seafood ramen and it was so delicious! I love seafood so it's perfect for me, not a big fan of the pork and such that is usually in ramen. Might come back again if I'm in the area!
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
I LOVE 21. Mainly because it doesn't hurt my wallet. Also because ramen is one of my favorite food groups and authentic ramen is obviously mucchhhh more expensive. 21 gets the job done if you only have $10 to spend. A ramen house with only one money sign is rare to find, so it's best not to expect high quality broth and noodles. 

I'm a spicy tonkatsu typa gal, so I'm at the point where I really don't need to glance at the menu anymore.. I admit, their chasu is hit or miss. Sometimes, it's a tad too chewy, but most of the time it's soft and tender with a hint of sweetness. The presentation is poor-- literally all the ingredients plopped in a bowl. It's all going in my stomach either way, so who cares. I don't :)
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
Was feeling ramen for lunch and 21 Taste House was close by, so we decided to hop on by. And boy, were we glad we did! 21 Taste House does solid ramen with friendly service. They even have free wi-fi! (Peep the password on their blackboard.)

21 Taste House's greatest strength is the bang for their buck. They have quite the bang! Although ramen seems to be the main draw, they also do other Japanese staples, like noodle dishes without soup, donburi, and curry rice. They offer ramen in the four main styles of broth you'd expect: tonkotsu, shoyo, miso, and shio. The toppings are quite customizable, and reasonable in price. There are a few "special" pre-made bowls, which are quite satisfying. You can also customize the spice level and each type of ramen comes with a different kind of noodle, too. The broth can be a little salty (but it could have been because I went for the shio ("salt") ramen), yet rich in flavor and spices. The noodles are soft and well cooked. I like the option to include quail eggs. They also do special "lobster ramen" which comes with a crawfish.

21 Taste House is a great place to go for a quick meal. It's not the most authentic/gourmet stuff, but it is satisfying.
author: Jade V.

description: I've been eating here like, I don't know, forever? Lol. This restaurant is the perfect spot for CCSF student to get lunch and dinner. They always have special weekly menu which make it easier for me to pick, try new things, and save money. The food portion is very good. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anybody that loves Japanese food!
author: Saharat S.

description: Nice neighborhood joint. Reasonable prices, complimentary hot tea, and friendly service.
author: Paul T.

description: I've been to so many ramen places in the area and this is by far the best. The owner is always so friendly and always greet us with a big smile when we walk in. I always come here for lunch and the wait isn't bad at all. We either get sat immediately or have to wait 5-10 mins. Portion size is big! They're really generous and when you see it, you'll know what I'm talking about. Price wise, it's fairly average among other competitors in the area. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Anna Y.

description: Quaint small ramen and more... Neighborhood feel and friendly staff. Never had a bad meal.
author: Manny D.

description:
This place was honestly OK.  I was kind of whatever about this place and the ramen as it was pretty mediocre. 
I got the medium spicy lobster pork tonkatsu ramen and it came with half a soft shelled crab and tiny little lobster on the side.  
Although the soup and cha siu were pretty decent, I recommend getting something different than what I ordered because of the lobster and soft shelled crab. 
I ended up not finishing my bowl after trying a bite of the soft shelled crab and getting a fishy taste out of it// sort of like fish tank taste? And then I tried again with the lobster and got the same kind of fishy taste. 
I normally eat a lot of fish prepared in all kinds of ways, so I'm more than okay with fishy tastes. But the crab/lobster tasted just weird and too fishy, which I never thot was possible for me. 

For the price and convenience in location, this ramen is pretty good but honestly I'd rather just save my money and go to some other ramen joint in Japantown or something that does a better job.
author: Daisy S.

description: Really basic ramen, nothing out of this world but better than the cup stuff. I really needed to get some ramen for a hangover food and this was the nearest place. So I walked over and picked some up togo. It is what it sets out to be, ramen. The takeout process was simple and the food was ready when I got there. The food just super bland and tasted a little stale. If you have the option try going somewhere else unless you're trying to bounce back from night of regretful decisions, then this place will do just fine.
author: Navdeep D.

description: Solid ramen place. Good food, great value and price. Will definitely come back again !!
author: Jennifer D.

description: I got the veggie broth ramen it was pretty good. Downside I got a stomach grrrr. But plus side the waitress was very nice the interior was intriguing the bathroom needs some work!!!!! Good ramen place I went here with my friend Gordon he liked it xd
author: Jo Y.

description:
Here almost once per week,
Service is very good. Nice and fast 

Good for small and big groups 

Food: current chicken over rice is just good, I love it.

Ramen is one of the best in the sunset area
author: Mack A.

description:
Checked this place out on a whim today for lunch (Friday around 12pm) with my BF and we enjoyed our overall expereince. 

FOOD: 
They have a large selection of ramen with different broths. Each item has it's own picture and list of ingredients explaining what broth and toppings each ramen is made of. In addition to ramen, they also have donburi and tapa items. I'm reviewing the Tonkatsu House special and the Garlic Tonkatsu. The regular Tonkatsu was pretty flavorful and great amount of toppings and not too oily. THe only complaint I have is that they didn't use actually "ramen" noodle (see pictures below). The texture of the boil egg was on point, but the marination could be better.  
Side note: they have two sizes - small and large. Small comes with a quail egg instead of a whole boil egg and of course, smaller portions. 

SERVICE: 
Super friendly and quick! They also have free wifi which is always a plus :) 

AMBIANCE: 
This place is located right next to city college and has metered parking as well as residential parking. The shop is actually decently sized with max capacity of 49 people to give an estimate. Good for parties 2-6. 

Overall, I would come back again if I were in the area and craving ramen.
author: Samantha F.

description: Came at ~11:45 but they were late opening. If their sign is off, hang out for a few minutes. Worth the wait. Giant bowls of ramen and yummy
author: chris k.

description: I dont get why rating is so low for this restaurant. Every time i come here it's always super delicious and service is great. The unagi fried rice is SO good yalll
author: Sarah G.

description: It's a nice cozy restaurant, not the most fanciest looking restaurant, but do provide good ramen and rice! The dishes are big too, worth the money to go!
author: Jacky W.

description:
Very disappointed with my most recent visit to 21 Taste House... My bf and I used to come here for our quick ramen fix, but probably not anymore.

They re-vamped the menu, and it looks great with new pictures and better organization. The old menu was sort of all over the place. However, now you can choose between two sizes of ramen (small or large). I ordered a small (black garlic tonkotsu ramen) because I could never finish the normal bowls. I figured it would have the same toppings that the other bowls had before. My bf ordered a small (honey pork belly ramen).

When we got the bowls, we both noticed the huge size difference. How depressing!! :( I also noticed that there was no bean sprouts in my soup like they used to have, and I only got 2 pieces of chasu compared to the 4 pieces that they used to give... Also, for a small, you now only get one quail egg instead of a soft boiled egg (they let you know this on the menu). The noodles were also lacking here, I think they give around 1/2 the portion that they used to.

Sadly, we won't be back.
author: Tara A.

description: Roasted pork and pork belly was nice and tender.  Broth and noodles were warm, which meant i didn't have to worry about burning myself, but it was already getting too cold before I could finish it.  Spicy broth was mild and not as deeply flavored as hoped, but the spinach and mushroom added a nice texture to the dish.
author: Maysee V.

description: Love this place! So friendly. I love ramen but it rearly fills me up. But not here! They load you up and I never finish my bowl. They don't skimp on toppings.  Easily our favorite ramen spot in the area.
author: Wheat T.

description: I wanted to like it. The service was fine and they're really nice. But the spicy kontatsu ramen was really fishy tasting. The potstickers were very good but the ramen broth was just really a deal breaker.
author: Chris t.

description:
This place was great! I have been living on this street for almost 7 years and have never tried this place! I don't know why! I was looking for Ramen this year and found this place was a few blocks from my house but it was closed on the day I wanted to go.

I finally went last night and it was great! I had the Tan Tan Ramen combo  and Seaweed Sald and my boyfriend got another type of Ramen with pork rib in it....and it was SO GOOD. The pork belly was on point and it was quickly served to us, we were in and out within 30 minutes. The server was very kind and attentive and kept filling up our water too! We will definitely not wait 7 years before coming back to this place!
author: Aimee E.

description: Food and service here is excellent! Huge bowls of ramen full of flavor and spice. Gyoza was tasty and chicken wings were also yummy!
author: Alea M.

description:
Been there twice and love this place so much, seeing it only have a 3.5 star so I have to write this 5 star review from the bottom of my heart.  First of all, to give you some background, I'm a ramen lover, I eat A LOT of ramen and I love spicy food. 

Honestly, before found out this place I tried most ramen houses in San Francisco and none of them satisfy my standard. Many of them are popular and have good ratings on Yelp but all of them are meh to me. So the first time I stepped into this place I expected nothing either. I ordered House Spicy noodles in medium spicy and Omg, I instantly fell in love with it. The broth was flavourful and PERFECT, not too salty nor too oily, and doesn't feel like it's anything made from powder. Not to mention they throw in soft shell crab, lobster tail, perfectly cooked pork, soft boiled quail eggs, some veggies to make it look like a FEAST while only paying as much as what you pay for a bowl of ramen elsewhere! With all the seafood in the soup, it doesn't have any overly fishy taste either.

Before I started writing this review, I glanced through some reviews for this place and I saw someone wrote that this is the best place ramen she has had. And I agree with her at least to the extent that it's the best Japanese style ramen in San Francisco I've had so far. It might sound exaggerating to some of you, but given that I love ramen and I eat a lot of them, this is truly the first Japanese style ramen I wanna have it again after having it twice already. Their service is fast and they have free wifi.

The second time I was there I had the house spicy ramen again, but this time I ordered the extra spicy. For all you spicy lovers out there, get this one! This is even better than the medium spicy! If you can't take much spicy food, medium spicy is also great! I also ordered their house special fried rice to go, and I love it too! I can't say it's the best out there, but def top 3 as well. It has a lot of varieties of meat and veggies in it, tastes delicious, and the portion is big enough to have one person to have for 2-3 meals :)

So this sums up my review. If you don't like ramen, don't like seafood, and don't like spicy food, I cannot guarantee that you'll like it. I seldom write reviews but am willing to take my time to review the ones I truly enjoy. :3
author: Shirley X.

description: their portions are so big that i always have to take it to go! the ramen, meat, and soup are so good . i've probably gone here 5 times in two weeks . my go to is the tan tan ramen spicy
author: John S.

description:
This place is definitely targeted to the college crowd/ early twenty eaters who are looking for comfort food of the Asian variety. So the ramen/ yakitori foodies stay away as this place is not for you.

When you walk in there's a lingering smell which is due to poor ventilation that took away from my eating experience so be forewarned. In lieu of ramen I ordered the squid ink ramen which was stuffed with imitation crab meat and other previously frozen seafood items. The broth was okay but definitely would not order again.

I also ordered the veggie fried rice which was very comforting to me and reminded me of what my mom would make as a kid. A little crispy but still moist and not too much soy sauce but not bland. Also while eating I noticed 2 college aged kids come in and they both ordered fried rice as well. Sounds like the thing to get here. I'd pass on the ramen.
author: Linda L.

description: This place was awesome! We called ahead for lunch with 11 people and our table was ready when we got here. They had kind and attentive service. The food was delicious and the portions are huge! I ordered the house miso. She even took the time to split up our checks at the end. The music is also good - always a bonus.
author: Emilia W.

description:
I went to lunch here on a Wednesday around 1:30pm.

Service: 
There were some people here, but there was plenty of space and we were seated quickly and given menus.  They checked in with us quickly and allowed us enough time to decide what we wanted.  Our food came out pretty quickly.

Food:
I ordered the Butter Corn Miso Ramen ($8.95 for large / $8.25 for small, if you want).  The description on the menu says: "Miso sauce base. Includes roast pork, corn, butter, green onion, egg, mushroom, sesame organic veggie and chicken gravy."  However, it pretty much only had the roast pork, corn, seaweed, egg and spinach.  It seemed to be missing the other ingredients (mushroom, green onion and butter, unless the butter melted before it got to my table).  The ramen was OK, nothing really special.  The people that I was with said their food was too salty, and one of them had the same order as mine.  The portion is pretty large.

Overall: 2.5 stars (rounded to 3 stars)
Would I come back? Probably not.  There are better ramen places.  Even the ramen place at the Westfied mall (Ajisen) is better than this place. I'd rather try out another place.
author: Gilda W.

description:
Beware the Chicken Gravy. I had the Tonkotsu Red-Chilli Oil Broth. 
The Chicken Gravy was so cold and bitter mineral taste. It sat in the center of the bowl between the noodles and the ramen toppings. Once I got to the chicken gravy I lost my appetite. There was a small amount red-chili oil splashed into the broth as an afterthought. 

There is better ramen in the city with similar price range.
author: Asia S.

description:
Weird place.
Definitely, one of the best ramen I've ever had. But sometimes they are closed on Sunday for absolutely no reason.
author: Evgenii G.

description: Love, Love, Love this place! I always get the House Speciality Ramen (Tonkatsu/medium spicy). It is out-of-this-world!! The quality of both the broth and ingredients is beyond any other ramen place I've ever been to. They include tons of pork (2 kinds, I think), a soft shell crab, quail eggs, half a chicken egg, plus a crawfish. My daughter got the Seafood Combo ramen, and it was fabulous, too.
author: Amber M.

description:
I ordered takeout and was surprised by how large the portions were! This is not a go to spot for the greatest ramen. This place is a quick pick me up if you're feeling ramen but cannot get to the best ones in town or if you aren't willing to travel quite a distance. Black Spicy Garlic Ramen was not too bad. The eggs were cooked perfectly and so was the pork(which were huge BTW). 

Definitely will come back again! I'd rather get this than a crappy PHO nearby.
author: Genatan O.

description: Ordered a number 10 spicy ramen. Had a stomach pain right after, and diarrhea in 3 hours and still in stomach pain. Ruin my whole day, Will not recommend it and returned
author: Jasper K.

description: Their portion is always good! Their appetizers are my recommendation, especially the tempura soft shell crabs (off the menu), but the special black garlic oil ramen comes with one. If the place offer sake or beer, it would be nice!
author: Jimmy W.

description:
I've had better ramen in my days... BUT this place is decent for this area. 

I was super hungry so then I searched up food then this place came up. Despite of it's stars, I came because there was still some good reviews and thought to try it out myself. I ordered the Tan Tan ramen. It was good! A the broth started off being a little thick then when I started mixing the ramen all together a couple times, it started to get thinned out. I asked for mild spicy because the lady had warned me about it being real spicy (mild was NOT spicy at all) SO if you're a big fan of spicy but don't want to eat spicy, just order the regular spicy. The mild is barely spicy. I ended up having to add more chili powder. When the broth is that thick, it's kind of bland eating it without any spice. It gets tiring to eat so I had to add some spice to eat. 

I also ordered a fried teriyaki chicken appetizer which I looooved! It's exactly what it's called. Fried chicken, with a teriyaki sauce drizzled over it. The texture and taste all together is just amazing!

Overall, I think this place is okay. It's definitely a place I'll keep in mind when I'm in the area and hungry. The place isn't too big either and especially because it's so close by schools, it gets packed during lunch time. The price is good too($7-9+), I can see why students would eat here.
author: Donna H.

description: Love it! I went to this place yesterday and it was great, the food is delicious and the server seem really nice so I went to this place today again
author: Chelsea ..

description: Pretty decent Ramen here. Restaurant is a bit small, so you might have to wait a bit to get in and not ideal for large parties. They have regular and large sized bowls here. The regular bowl comes with 1 quail egg and the large with 2 nornal soft boiled eggs. The special of the day comes in an extra large bowl. The only thing that I did not like is that I had the lobster and crab special but there was only 1 piece of lobster and 2 pieces of crab. They put corn, pork and a lot of other stuff in it to make up for it. The appetizers here are pretty good and you get a lot for what you pay. Customer service is really good as well. Whenever my water cup was half empty, the waitress automatically brought me a new cup. Overall, I enjoyed my experience here.
author: Dang L.

description:
I ordered a regular miso ramen with tofu (add $1) and my friend got regular tonkatsu ramen and takoyaki.

For a dollar, the little amount of tofu they gave me was very disappointing.

We ordered both of our ramen with no spiciness at all and the soup was very salty. They add a lot of MSG though.

The noodles was very chewy! Not bad.

The seaweed was so bad it looked like those expired bad quality seaweed.

The takoyakis looked like they were deep fried and it's not supposed to be like that. It didn't taste bad but I would not get them again.

Overall, the place was OK. Customer service was good although the tables and floor were a little bit sticky. I would not come here again.
author: Kathy D.

description: I really enjoyed this ramen place since the customer service was good and the ramen was good too. I chose a deluxe ramen and the portion was good. I will come back again; although, parking is hard.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Coming here I was expecting just an OK experience cuz my friend said it was just "aight" and the place fails to hold a 4 star rating for being new.

Surprisingly I am so impressed with this small hole in the wall restaurant. Place is pretty small with not a lot of customer so obviously my expectations got lower and lower when I enter this place.

I got the Tonkotsu ramen extra extra spicy but told her I want the ground pork meat instead of chasu and she gladly accommodated me. My boo got shoyu ramen and he enjoyed it as well. Portion is huge imo especially these ramen cost around $7-$9 so yeah SUPER cheap!!! 

We also got a side of honey pork belly for $2 and wow I was so shocked to see how much they gave us lol they are GENEROUSSS!! We also got a side of noodle and guess what... Pretty good size too. I am just in heaven when I was there lol cheap yummy food is my thanggg!!

Service was amazing. She's the cutest asian lady. Love her!! Very genuine and sweet.

My total was $20. We left so full and happy :)
author: Debbie D.

description:
Got the tonkotsu ramen with the bells and whistles for about $11. I knew I made a mistake the moment I took a sip of the water and tasted what felt like cheap bottled water left out in the sun for a week. The food itself was wholly unremarkable, awfully presented and not exactly tasty--there were parts that made me gag, such as the pork too tough to cut and the weird seafoodish bits that tasted like minced pork.

The cherry on the cake was the gall of the server to tell me that credit cards were a minimum of $15. I know these scams thrive off tax evasion, but $15? She took my card and told me that I'd have to pay with cash 'next time'. Good luck getting that 'next time', buddy.
author: Amitabho C.

description: This place is awesome! No wait on a Friday afternoon, let's go! I ordered a classic ramen tonkatsu ramen and I checked in for a good deal!!!
author: Wesley W.

description: Nice ambience and kind service! If you're craving ramen in the ingleside neighborhood, I would recommend checking this place out. I got the medium spicy tonkatsu ramen and it was good! Thick juicy charsu pork and flavorful broth. Also, it's a big bowl of ramen!
author: Ryan U.

description: Perhaps they are under new management or renovation, but I just called and was told they don't open for another month. Hope to try it then.
author: Conery W.

description: This place seems to closed... the phone goes straight to voicemail and is never been open the few times I tried to go there.
author: bella l.

description: Ate here with the family and this place did not disappoint.  Reasonable prices for HUGE bowl of good tasting ramen.  The chicken kraage was also really good.
author: Stephen S.

description: This is the best and most amazing ramen place I ever been to!! I ordered a chicken combo ramen and it's super good. The taste is not too salty, not too light, just right! The waiter who served me had really good service. He was really patient and had high energy. I totally recommend this place!!
author: Sophie L.

description: This probably was one of the best ramen places I've went to. The chicken was fresh and the soup was very tasty. I would recommend the chicken combo. But so sad they didn't have beef ramen, it would've been better if it was beef but their chicken was also good as well.
author: Asma K.

description:
Agedashi tofu is one of my favorite foods that I'm always craving! Since CCSF is right around the corner and I have an hour long break between my classes, this is my go to place when I want a quick, small and cheap bite to eat. 
Although this is a ramen house, all I order is their agedashi tofu. Perfect amount of crispy and their dashi sauce is also pretty good, not too salty and not too bland. $5.17 gets me an appetizer of agedashi tofu which to me is my whole meal here, pretty filling and satisfying without over stuffing myself! Definitely worth trying.
author: Amanda R.

description: parking wasn't bad at all, this is probably the best ramen place next to CCSF!! ordered fried tofu, and two ramen.
author: Kingsley W.

description: Best place to go eat after class. Portion size is big and price is decent. Out of the 5 times I came here I never had to wait to be seated it. The wait for the food comes out pretty quick which is a plus because I always have class afterward and I never had to rush.
author: Johnny Y.

description:
21 Taste is just 11 shy of Baskin Robin's 32 flavors. Don't worry, maybe you'll catch up someday. 

I stopped in for a bowl of ramen since 90% of the restaurants on Ocean were closed by 8:00pm on a Sunday. Having visited Japan about a month ago, my ramen standards have forever been ruined. However, I'm a simple person and with low expectations and 21 Taste fit the bill. 

+ Fit the bill = the $10 price point was right for the large portion, quality ingredients, and kind service.
+ Honestly, the broth tasted like some Chinese people made it. I mean.. Ocean is a Chinese dominant area so I didn't expect them to have imported some Japanese Ramen Master to teach the secrets of broth making. Not impressing but absolutely bet my expectations.
+ The Spicy Tonkatsu won't light you up if you eat spicy food regularly but the house-made chili P was a pleasant surprise of flavor.
+ There is a daily list of $6.75 specials in front of the restaurant. I forgot to take a picture.
+ $15 credit card minimum

This is definitely a very solid 3 star establishment (meets expectations) but the only standout characteristic is that it's the only ramen place on the block. Give it a try if you're craving a bowl of noodles.
author: Chris W.

description: I came here many times after I got off from school. I really recommend this place's ramen and fried rice. Some of their appetizer also tastes really good too! it is usually very busy around lunch time hours during school days so be prepared. This place is good for anyone and it has free wifi too, so I highly recommended!!
author: Jay L.

description:
Big menu. Mostly Japanese cuisine, with a few Chinese dishes, too. (No sushi.) Rice bowls, ramen soup, cold ramen, yakisoba, curry rice, salads and more. 

Started with the deep fried platter. Egg rolls, wings, chicken nuggets and fish cake. Fish cake = favorite, followed by the chicken wings. 

Premium hand made pork ramen, added one soft boiled egg, and it was perfect for me.  Ramen is topped with woodear mushrooms (black fungus), scallions, and bean sprouts for crunch.  Ramen was cooked perfectly and delicious. Broth is addicting.  Thick but tender sliced pork.  Worth trying.

Pickles combo (kimchi and seaweed salad). Chilled, tangy and the perfect accompaniment for piping hot bowls of ramen.  

Service = friendly.  Clean tables. Five 4-tops and four 2-tops, so if you're a large group, plan accordingly.  Free Wi-Fi for paying customers. 

Prices = moderate.  Two bowls of ramen, two appetizers, and two drinks for $40.00 (pre-tip). 

Glad to find ramen closer to home!!
author: Fannie S.

description:
21 Taste House? Where is it at, 21 Jump St?

The interior is small, but seems more narrow due to the choice of red walls & black furniture. 

Service is always different with each visit. But overall, it's not that great.

Food-wise, its decent, but one could find way better elsewhere. Their water tastes really peculiar, like fountain water does. I guess there's supposed to be some sort of hint of lemon but it strangely tastes more like dishsoap. The prices for their dishes are too high for the amount of food given to you. The food also looks like food that you honestly could make yourself without having to spend those bucks in your pocket. I guess the most decent dish for me would have to be the fried tofu. Their desserts are somewhat good, but so oily that I felt my arteries slowly dying!

They only accept cash. Boooo.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
I'm new to the neighborhood and extremely happy to have found this place.
$8 bowls of tasty ramen will definitely satisfy me on a cold and foggy SF night/weekend.

I got the black garlic tonkotsu ramen. Spicy with corn. It was very good for its price and I was surprised how flavorful the broth and meat was in the bowl. 

I will definitely be coming back as i think this place is much better than some of the other options on Ocean Avenue.
author: Cicely T.

description:
This is one of those hole in the wall restaurants that no one really knows about but should. Let me tell you, I have waited almost an hour and a half for Ramen Dojo in San Mateo and the it is very comparable.
This ramen is better than any ramen places I been to.
Their choices and as well as their toppings in their ramens. They really do have all the things you want in your ramen.
Just think of Ramen Dojo from San Mateo in San Francisco with no wait and a great price.
I usually get the House Spicy Ramen because it comes extra-spicy.
author: Ariunaa B.

description:
I cannot comprehend why this play has less than 5 stars.

Okay - So the service isn't great. The decor is terrible. The location is pretty far south.

None of that matters. 21 Taste House has some of the best spicy Ramen I've ever had. I live downtown and go out of my way to come here. The "Tan Tan Ramen Combo" (Roast pork, minced pork, and pork belly) has some of the best broth I've ever had. All the ingredients taste fresh and go really well together. It's also only $11, where the average bowl of ramen in SF is usually $15+.
author: Tim M.

description: I've been wanting to come here for a while since this was the closest ramen place around. When I walked in, the waitress was mopping the floors, while 2 patrons were eating... what?! Upon seating, I quickly felt the sticky and gross table. Why was it sticky... At that point, I was kind of grossed out BUT WHAT IF THE FOOD TASTED GREAT?! Ordered a ramen and yakisoba. Yakisoba was a little too salty. Noodles were the good kind of chewy. Had the tonkatsu ramen and that was just alright... The broth was pretty oily though. And I had no idea what that white stuff on top was. At first I thought it was cottage cheese but then it tasted garlicky. But it doesn't even look like garlic!? I was very confused. Also the thai tea was BLAND. Didn't taste like anything. Ugh prob not going to be coming back...
author: Benita M.

description:
Ramen is good

Got the short rib ramen

Not bad at all for the price

I figured I give the place a shot since its close by and I am glad that I did
author: Peter Y.

description: This place was great. Had tangkastsu Lobster Ramen.  Fast service, great flavor broth and not too crowded.
author: Michael F.

description:
The food here was so foul we left without finishing our food.  Even living across the street, we have never returned after our first visit.

This place should be shut down - any other ramen place in the entire city would be better.
author: Jacob F.

description: Walked in around 7pm on a Thursday night and only one table was filled. About 10 minutes later quickly people came in and filled about 5 tables. Ordered the tonkatsu ramen (mild spicy) and the Miso ramen (medium spicy), added tofu ($1) to both. Definitely should have added more noodles because there seemed to not be enough. Overall, a decent ramen with a decent price, but for the taste I wish it was cheaper.
author: Courtney D.

description:
Came back again yesterday with my friend. Ramen was good but I was sad to find that my egg was still cold (probably due to refrigeration?).
On the plus side, my friend said she enjoyed the vegetable ramen, which is good because it's easy to get that wrong. We'll be back to see what the ramen is like the third time around.
author: Clarissa M.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised to find that the broth here is pretty good! Not too salty and very flavorful. 

I usually ask for my Ramen here without the meat. It's a little tough and not very flavorful therefore just a waste for me to eat.

I usually get the tonkotsu or tonkotsu with black garlic oil. While I'm in the area this place will suffice for almost all Ramen cravings.

Noodles are pretty good and the service is very friendly.
author: Melissa C.

description: Ordered Sesame wings "10" pieces. In reality it's 5, they just split them in half to make it look like there's 10.. never eating here again. Ramen took 30 minutes for it to come out. Don't say there are 10 pieces of wings if you gonna cut them in half and jip customers. Food is cold too.
author: Tim M.

description: 3.5 stars- Ramen here is pretty good, although not authentic. The menu is half ramen and half Chinese food- lots of choices ranging from around $6-$9. I have only tried the ramen here (tonkatsu), and it satisfied my cravings, and came in a big bowl. I liked the boiled egg, and the meat pieces were delicious. The soup itself could have been made hotter though. It tasted a little cold. Service was good, and the waitress never left my tea empty. I would come back for the convenience.
author: Corinna T.

description:
The San Francisco Astrological Society was having a meeting at the Ingleside library and wanted to find a restaurant that was close so we could have dinner afterward. I looked to Yelp to check out what was available in the neighborhood. A lot of restaurants are closed on Sunday. Some that were close by had a "health warning" and that wasn't going to work. 

Then I found "21 Taste House." I saw that it had good reviews, some vegetarian selections, and more than Ramen to choose from. The price was within our budget so I suggested to the Steering Committee that we give it a try.

We showed up about a quarter to 5pm and there was enough space available for the 7 of us. The service was quick and pleasant. We had appetizers: Vegetarian spring rolls, goyza, and pickled selection of seaweed and kim chi. That kept us happy and busy until our meals showed up. 

About half of us got the same Domburi: Tonkatsu with egg over rice. Which I can testify was delicious. The rest of our group got various Ramen selections. Mostly everyone said what they ordered was delicious. The telling moment was when all conversation stopped because everyone was busy eating. The portions were large enough that a couple of us had to ask for To-Go boxes for the left overs. Only one of our group wasn't thrilled with her choice but I feel it was because it was very foreign fare for her. She still ate most of her meal though.  

I am very pleased with "21 Taste House" and can't wait to take my family there because the food was good, the price was reasonable, the people were friendly, it's open until late, as well as being open on Sunday, there's free WiFi, and it is close to my home.
author: Nora S.

description: Incredible tasty food and nice staff, politely quiet and very responsive to the customers. I would recommend it as regular dinner spot because the prices are reasonable enough. At least it is my regular dinner spot already!
author: Flora K.

description:
Yayy!! Finally a ramen place within a mile of my house! :D

Our table ordered the honey pork belly, veggie curry rice, curry katsu ramen, and spicy tonkatsu ramen (medium). 

The pork belly came out first and that was really good! Not sure if it was cause we were starving but it had the right amount of sweetness and was cooked perfectly. I'll give that a 4 star :D

The curry rice gets a 3 star cause it was nothing special, gets a bit blah after the first few bites. 

I had a piece of the chicken Katsu from the Katsu ramen and I really liked it! The Katsu pieces were covered with curry and that was really yummy. I'll give this dish a 4 star!

The spicy tonkatsu ramen was pretty good! I really liked their flavorful broth and half boiled egg. The dish did get a bit overwhelming towards the end but that might just be cause I was getting really full =P I will this a 4 star too! 

Overall, this might just be my go to place for ramen cause it's so close to my home and I can't wait to try their other types of ramen and appetizers!
author: Heidi V.

description: Food here has been pretty good, but their lunch special menu is inaccurate -- they are usually out of their special for days at a time. Change the special to something that is available, why don't you?
author: James C.

description:
Tried out 21taste house and not impressed. The boyfriend and I stopped by this place after finding out our pho spot wasn't opened on Tuesday. When we were seated, the tables were so sticky!! I couldn't stand it. 

We ordered two fried garlic ramen and they were really bland. The broth was not creamy and there was what seemed to be cabbage in my bowl. Never seen that before, how unique. More into the toppings though, oh right, there's barely anything there. Two pieces of chashu for a small size and three for a large. The chashu was good but that was only it. Other than that, there's only a few strands of cabbage and mushroom. How stingy... And where's the egg?? NO EGG?? I've never seen a place where they serve ramen without a hard boiled egg... Basically, nothing stood out. Maybe we should have ordered something else? 

The staff here is alright. It was pretty dead and we never got checked up on. I guess that's how they run things here? Oh well. Just some ramen shop thats opened for mostly ccsf students I guess. For crappy ramen and okay service, I probably wouldn't come back.
author: Abby C.

description:
I have been here 2x now and I am still in love! Ramen is one of my favorite soups to eat (sorry pho!) and I found this gem right down the street from my house. I am surprised it isn't busier because I always able to walk right in and order. So the service was fast the waitress was really nice both times. 

The first time I ordered the normal Miso Ramen and the second time i tried the Miso Lobster with black garlic. Both very good but if I go back I am getting the lobster ramen again. Curious to see how their curry is!
author: Jordan R.

description: I absolutely love this place! From the sweet smile of the woman that greets you when you walk in,  to the crunchy addictive nature of the best (in-house) kimchee I've ever had, and finally, the pièce de résistance, the ramen (especially B15 for me!)...a thing of beauty it is... the creamy broth coats the chewy noodles and all the surrounding tid bits of goodness like a big hug in your mouth.
author: Layne C.

description: Came here for a quick lunch with the family. Pretty small restaurant, but we were seated quickly. Ordered the large Tonkatsu ramen (~$10) and it was pretty good. The yolk in the eggs are not cooked fully so they are a little runny, which is what makes it yummy! My mom ordered the Honey Pork Belly ramen, and the pork belly was sooooo good. Would definitely come here again for some ramen!
author: Linda C.

description: Came in this evening, and ordered a ramen with a shellfish based broth (I have an allergy to particular types of shellfish). It didn't occur to me to ask them if the broth had the specific shellfish until I got home. When I called, they told me that it was all in one (with their shellfish), but gave me another pork-based ramen for FREE. Definitely coming back here, as the ramen was really good too.
author: Trevor D.

description:
I ordered the Tan Tan. It was yummy! I'd recommend getting the mild of you are a heat chicken. 

Good value. Friendly staff. Ready and waiting for me when I walked in.

Try it!
author: Sara C.

description: I'm surprised this place isn't packed! I've tried tons of ramen places & most are very disappointing to me. So I didn't expect much from this place but it's actually really really good!!! I got the extra spicy tonkatsu ramen & my friend got the tonkatsu ramen. The broth is amazing, it's very flavorful! One downside is that I wished they added more toppings. But other than that, this place is great. I highly recommend it. I'm definitely coming here again!
author: Jenefer N.

description:
Worthy of a long review!
I was staying 2 blocks away in an airbnb rental and was looking for somewhere to eat within walking distance.  As I walked by I noticed the posters of their photographed ramen selection on the front window and it caught my attention!  I'm a visual person so after looking at ramen bowls perfectly staged it didn't take me long to decide on giving it a try.
We were greeted and seated right away by the friendly waitress.  My eyes had decided on the spicy ramen but after perusing the menu I decided to go with the pork rib donbury since I've never seen that dish on a menu before.  I'll cut to the chase...it was delicious!  It was a bowl of rice with steamed cabbage and perfectly slow cooked pork spare ribs in a slightly sweet, anise, and asian spiced bbq sauce.  My girlfriend had the butter corn miso ramen and the broth blew me away!  It was a miso based broth that was just the right amount of salty and deep flavor, the noodles were cooked just over al dente, the soft boiled tea egg was cooked perfectly, as well as the tonkatsu roasted pork.  The dish that really stole the show was the Teba-fry (house special fried chicken wings).  It was love at first bite!  The chicken was well seasoned, coated in flour, then deep fried.  The skin was extra crispy!  They sprinkle it with their homemade chili powder and it was a nice touch to remind you that you are in a Japanese restaurant.  Last but not least was the side of homemade kimichi...to be honest, it's the best I've had in the loooong time.  I'm from Hawaii and have been eating kimchi all of my life.  I don't know how to explain it, you'll just have to try it for yourself ,but I'm not kidding....it's seriously good!  
It's a small resaurant which consists mainly of tables for 2 and 4, but with some rearranging they could accommodate larger parties.  I did a rough count and counted 26 seats.  The bathroom could use a facelift and the decor is nothing fancy, but this should not be expected for a place where the meals are priced for those looking for good food but within a modest budget.
I have no problem dining here again...matter of fact, I'm looking forward to it!
author: Shanda B.

description: Ordered seafood ramen to go which made me feel pretty sick the next day.  The broth was flavorful, but the ramen noodles this time were far from springy, quickly turning to mush as I reheated on the stove.  The seafood was plentiful, but mostly dry and rubbery as it always overcooked by the time you get it.  Ordered an unmemorable seaweed salad, very stringy and a pretty good tofu appetizer, but won't be back. The thought of that ramen will keep me away.
author: Rose B.

description:
This place was surprisingly decent. I had the spicy tonkatsu and teriyaki chicken for my daughter. The taste was good..it wasn't bland and not too salty. It was just right minus the flavor that takes you beyond just good. 

The portion was also decent and the service was great except for their cheap plastic cups. The place is small and narrow with lots of street parking.
author: Lloyd M.

description: Was craving ramen for breakfast after a vacation.  Yelp said they opened at 10.  Came by and they were closed.
author: Shannon S.

description: Been there twice and love this place so much.I have to write five stars review from the bottom of my hear. I eat a lot of ramen and I love spicy fod. I will be back soon.
author: Jenny H.

description:
Not the world's best broth, nor is it going to hit the ramen spot you've been itching. Pork bone base is salty and not in a good way, and the noodles are like chow mein noodles. Don't come here for ramen. The chasu and egg are decent.

I will come back for the fried food. They do a bombass version of karaage (Japanese fried chicken). On top of good battered chicken, they add bonito flakes, some tonkatsu sauce, and sriracha mayo. Definitely come back for fried food!
author: Michelle N.

description: INSANELY awesome ramen, especially for the price. quick service, friendly people. very simple restaurant but the food and prices make it perfect.
author: Jonathan Q.

description:
I really wanted this place to be good.

My friends say not to give a bad review to small joint like this. Why I say? They think it is a negative on people who are just trying to make a living. Well, my review nor the fake 5 star reviews for this joint really won't impact their success as much as their food and service. Having tried one of their 21 Tastes, won't be back to "double down" and increase my odds of having a good hand, ahh meant "meal".  (for those who missed it, that was a reference to the card game "21")

So here I's go.

The food

It ain't good. Thought the broiled pork chop on rice was a safe bet. Nope. It was pieces of pork cooked with oyster sauce & soy sauce and onions in a bowl over rice. The meat tasted as if it had been recently thawed from the era of the Ming Dynasty, dipped in sauce and fried.  Some of the white onions were the skin peal, too tough to eat. It was bad. It was short grained rice, but a low quality.Very interesting that this was one of the lunch "Bento Specials". 

Ramen was the other dish at our table. Seemed like a miso base. Noodles were egg noodles. Just something very odd about the flavor. About as Japanese as Mushu Pork or Egg Fu Young.

Chinese tea pre-brewed in "da big pot".

The Service

Nice & pleasant. Smiling waitresses. Was super attentive to keep the plastic tea cup filled.

The Digs

21 Taste House has a veneer (very thin) of Japanese restaurant. Some items on the menu that are Japanese. Ramen, Age dashi dofu, some cooked item sushi rolls etc. The decor is a mix of Japanese wall hanging bamboo vases - the 99 cent version.

The question & philosophy

Why not just be what you are, serve food that you know with descriptions that are accurate? Drop the Japanese veneer and be at one with the I Ching and you might start to hear that register ring.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
This is my husband and I go to place for ramen cause it's so close to home. I am extremely happy to have found this place. Very good ramen that will satisfy you on a cold SF weather. Super friendly and excellent service every time we eat here. 

I always order the Curry Chicken Katsu Ramen. And even though it's not on the menu anymore, they still make it just for me, every time! 5 stars for that! My husband always enjoy his Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen. We always leave full and happy
author: Jingle A.

description:
I went here with my family because they wanted to check out more restaurants in the neighborhood. I wanted to like this place because it's a local small business. It's alright, but could use some work. It seems that their menu changes often (and it's also pretty small). My dad wanted something that was pictured in the store front but the waitress said they don't have that yet. They also didn't have normal to-go menus because they don't have a set menu yet. Is this place relatively new?

I got the Tonkatsu ramen which included sliced pork, seaweed, bamboo shoots, and bean sprouts. Not the typical ramen dish, more on the Chinese side. Noodles were ok, but the soup was WAY too salty. My mouth and lips had this weird sensation afterwards. The sliced pork had a bit of bbq pork (like Chinese deli type) flavor and the pieces were too tough, thick, and difficult to chew.

Other dishes we ordered: the chicken teriyaki rice bowl and unagi rice bowl. The broccoli on the side was too hard and raw seeming. Unagi did not taste fresh. 

Portions were good, not to much or too little. Service was attentive, but the wait for food may take a while.

Overall, mediocre. Less sodium and fresher ingredients would be my suggestion! If they change up their menu maybe I'll come again.

Cash only.
author: Mary X.

description: Stopped by for a quick ramen fix & was really satisfied with the ramen! There was only one host/waitress so it did take sometime to get the food and check, but other than that she was very friendly and the food was pretty good.
author: Rj L.

description: Needed some good hot food after the HSB 2016, our usual place was crowded. Ended up in this neighborhood what a great find! Broth was tasty, presentation was great, had #B8,  watch out for the spicy level though, my dining partner ordered medium....they blend their own spices, it was spicy hot for medium. Ignore the negative reviews and give this place a try.
author: K T.

description: Was looking for a ramen place that didn't have parking hardships so we picked this place. Prices were super reasonable and since I like to add a lot of toppings it didn't break the bank. But overall it was just okay ramen. Definitely not the worst but wasn't impressed.
author: Nicole G.

description: This place gets the job done. You're not going to have the best guest service it's usually one lady who will be on her phone, or has to run the entire store, it also won't  have nice decor. But the food is amazing, get to try all the chef suggestion. The food is cheap and the portion is great!
author: Clifton N.

description: This is by far one of the best Ramen places  I've been to . Their spicy Tan Tan Ramen was exceptional. The prices are great and the people are friendly.
author: Kim O.

description: I ordered for to-go an hour ago and I must say that I'm impressed with the ramen. I ordered the spicy tonkotsu ramen in medium spicy with honey pork belly and the house special sauce. The total came out to be about $14. I think it's a pretty standard price for ramen in the city. The pork belly was $2 and it came with 5 big pieces! Such a great price. The ramen came with 3 fatty slices of pork, 2 quail eggs, half of a soft boiled egg, one nori piece, spinach, and kikurage mushrooms. The broth was very flavorful and you can taste the spiciness. There was not too much oil but the ramen overall was heavy. I'm not sure if it's something wrong with me, but every time I eat ramen from restaurants, it makes me feel ugh after. However, I don't regret a thing at all because the ramen is surprisingly really good! The waitress working today was friendly and the service was quick. I will be back to try other ramen that they have!
author: Brenda K.

description: This is a small hole in the wall place on ocean just a hop skip and a jump from city college. It's great when you get to school early or get out early. Various ramen available for those chilly SF nights like tonight & donburi & other rice plates available if you're not in the mood for soup. By far the best thing I've had here is their chicken karaage appetizer. The portion for a "small" is worth the $7.95 you pay, at least in my opinion. It's not your typical karaage. Teriyaki glaze & kyupi mayonnaise zigzag the tops of the chicken pieces, and then they sprinkle nori (seaweed) strips & katsuobushi (bonito fish flakes) atop the sauce drizzled chicken. I ask for mine with no katsuobushi because I'm allergic to fish & they're very accommodating about that. I have however, also brought it home for the rest of my family with the katsuobushi on top and they love what it adds to the chicken. In other news I've only had their Black Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen and it's delicious. You can also add sides of things like egg, kimchi etc to your bowl of Ramen. I definitely recommend this place. It's a little on the small side with no good place to park around other than street parking but I take the bus everywhere so that isn't an issue for me. And when I come I've never had to wait for a table for one. Not the place for a huge group tho. They only have 5 two-person tables and 5 four-person tables. So that's about 30 max seating. But come if you're in the neighborhood & have a hankering for some delicious warming Japanese food.
author: Hitomi S.

description: Pretty good broth but so disappointed in the size, toppings and presentation. I came here after a long run and was excited to reward myself with a big bowl of ramen. Little did I know the 'small' was almost 1/4 of the bowl and there was almost nothing in the bowl! A piece of meat, 2 lousy pieces of spinach and half of one egg. Also, there is a $15 min for credit cards and $2 charge for anything under $15. The lady was nice enough to waive it for me since it's my first time here but I still won't be back.
author: Samantha S.

description:
New restaurant here in this area and it is very close to City College of San Francisco Main Campus. The food and beverage items here are appropriately priced. The staff here are very nice and their service is very good. I came in here during lunch hour so both waitress were processing multiple orders. While I was waiting for my food, I noticed the chefs were carefully checking the order number as they cooked the meals. They get props for making sure customers orders are correctly fulfilled in addition to increasing efficiency. This restaurant isn't very spacious so it is not extremely suitable for very large groups.

Here are some of the items I ordered on my first visit:
1) Pork Sausage
2) Soy Milk

I am craving for a plate of rice and chicken which one item I'll try the next time I come here. Overall, I had a very good first experience here. The service is very good but there is room for improvement and it can still be better. As an advisory, this place is cash only!

Parking: Street Parking

Public Transportation:
29 Sunset
K Ingleside / T Third Street
49 Van Ness / Mission
8X Bayshore Express / 8BX Bayshore B Express

FYI as of 08/15/2014:
Current Hours of Operation
Monday - Friday 10:00 am - 9:00 pm
Saturday & Sunday 10:30 am - 9:00 pm
author: Bennett W.

description: My boyfriend and I were feeling under the weather yesterday and tried to find some hot soup nearby. I've seen this place a few times walking around Ocean and finally gave it a go. Let's just say I'm sad I didn't try it sooner! I know the reviews are mixed, but I thoroughly enjoyed my Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen with added roasted garlic. The base was flavorful, the pork was flavorful and tender, and the soft boiled egg was cooked perfectly. The portions were completely generous. I may be biased as there are not a lot of good options around Ocean, but I would definitely eat this again. We also got the gyoza which I thought was great.
author: Bernadette R.

description:
21 Taste House is kind of a sketchy looking restaurant located near City College. 

== Food ==

The ramen here gets a borderline pass. It's not awful, but it's definitely not good. It's decent overall. Premium pork spicy tonkotsu ramen was what I got. The broth was alright. My problem with it was it wasn't fatty and creamy as how tonkotsu broth usually is. The noodles are nicely done. The premium pork wasn't so premium. There was bones in my pork that I had to spit out. The flavor of the pork was pretty good.

== Service ==

Service is good. The waitress is very nice.

== Overall ==

If your expectations are right. Cheap and decent. This place is for you. This place seems to cater toward students, which makes sense because it's right next to city college. While it's not the best ramen out there. The price is right for the quality they provide.
author: Steven B.

description: I rated four star because their ramen soup is good but missing something intense. They have kid size which is different from other ramen restaurants.
author: Linh C.

description: The selection is pretty good for such a small restaurant. I got the small black garlic tonkatsu ramen and small chicken karage. The small ramen is truly a small ramen but the small karage felt like a large karage.  The food was pretty good. The noodles were perfect (aka on the harder side) and the broth was very flavorful. The regular spicy was a little too much for me so I suggest getting mild if you like spicy but don't want to leave with your mouth burning. Decent place considering the area it is in. Will come back again to try another broth!
author: Evonne T.

description: Maybe it's just the friendly atmosphere that makes the ramen here so decent. I usually get the usual and  it's always on point.
author: Tuyen N.

description: Pretty decent aside from the pepper corns found throughout. The tofu was silky and the broth more spicy and flavorful than ramen dojo for sure.
author: Zaviera R.

description:
I've tried to come here twice before since it is close to home, but for some odd reason, it was closed both times. Well, third time's the charm!

The boyfriend and I both had ramen. I ordered the Seafood Ramen. The ramen was good, and the spiciness was just enough, but the seafood was pretty lacking since it was mostly imitation crab meat. BUT, my boyfriend ordered a ramen with pork, and it was great! The meat was soft and juicy. 

The waitress was very polite, and she was equally polite to all the customers.
