The place is very small, and you could very easily hear other conversations. I didn't like the dark decor, and I also thought the place could be a lot cleaner.

Overall, I like the location, the food, and the service. The interior could use some work.

FYI, cash only if under $15.
author: Vivi S.

description: Time for chicken curry powder ramen, EXTRA spicy yum! This place is always on their game when it comes to making fantastic, fresh ramen. Always check Their special menu out front for something new!
author: Justin B.

description: Loved the spicy tonkatsu ramen. Also the chicken wings were really good. They were drizzled with a teriyaki sauce with some green onion and they give you 10 for 5 bucks. Really good value. Good service. Would come here again!
author: Erick S.

description:
I got the Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen.

Ramen was pretty good. They gave me 4 pieces of pork. It was not thin but actually with nice thickness. The pork slices also were marinated because each bite had flavor. They also gave 1 poached egg split in two. The broth was not bad but not the best. Better than the raman place in Colma.  They amount of noodles they gave was good too. If you can eat hot cheetos,  I recommend at least the medium spice.  I would get extra spicy next time.

I'm surprise they aren't busy. It's all good so I don't ever have to wait.

Yes I will come back again. Good ramen fix which is walking distance from my house.
author: Gwen K.

description:
I really love this place.  It isn't anything too extravagant, and doesn't try to be anything crazy.  The reason that I love this place is that the ramen is decently good here at a very affordable price.  And they deliver!!! A ramen place that delivers!  

I love the buttered corn ramen and usually add spice to it. That is my favorite suggestion.

The service is always pretty good too.  I've only had the same waitress the past five times I've been, so I'm lead to believe that its only her, but she always checks in on you and never makes you feel like a bother to ask her for something.  Most often she's already looking at the tables and waiting to see if anyone needs anything.  My water is always filled up, which goes a long way in my book.  

Also for you students out there, this location does provide free wifi.  Its very close to the bus stops, so if you're waiting to catch your bus, or want to grab a bite without being too far from the bus system, 21 Taste House is the place to go.

My only complaint would be the metered parking (but what street parking in SF isn't metered).  And I kind of wish the name of the restaurant was something else. Something a little more catchy.  Cause its a wonderful little spot, and I really would like to see it do well.
author: John L.

description: I love this ramen place and it has a lot of variety of ramen choices to choose from. Staff are nice and super helpful. I come here so often that I can call it home!
author: Qingxiu Y.

description:
You would never expect this place to be as good as it is. I mean the ubiquitous name, (why 21? And "taste house"? Whaaaahht?) doesn't say anything related to Japanese ramen. Its location, across City College San Francisco, can be thought of as brilliant. Aren't noodles supposed to be for the price conscious?
I'm Japanese (from Hawaii, not Japan), but I am always looking for a close noodle place. Of course, it needs to be worthy of driving and finding parking for. Ocean Avenue can be challenging, but if there is a will there is a way. We tried a Vietnamese noodle place on Ocean near Keystone Way, but I got a terrible MSG headache soon after eating there. My search continued.
I recall seeing 21 Taste House after a trip to Whole Foods. I know, WHOLE FOODS??? Well, they are great if you are picking your kid at 6pm from afternoon soccer practice and haven't started dinner yet. Anyway, back to 21 Taste House. I saw a sign on the sidewalk in front of their place and caught my eye. Ramen?? *note to self* gotta check this place out!
Went there with my daughter first. They have a great selection of ramen styles, definitely one to suit anyone's fancy. I pretty much go for the tonkotsu style (pork broth) ones. My daughter got the butter corn ramen, which I never knew such a thing even existed. The portions are great and the pork cuts and fixings in the dish are nice too! For the price, you can't beat it in the neighborhood.
Our friends took us to Ajisen in the food court at Westfield mall. They swore Arisen was worthy of the drive to Soma and paying to park! Well, 21 Taste House is waaaaay better (in my opinion)! Sure, the tables aren't sticky like at 21 Taste House, but are you there to eat ramen or touch the tables? *pa dum pssh*
I've only tried the ramen, so say much about the other items on the menu. The waitress is Chinese but supposedly the chef is Japanese.
author: Mark M.

description: I've been here twice and been happy both times with the ramen. Broth is very rich and flavorful, lots of meat and tonkatsu is generous. The eel over rice was huge and very filling. $15 min on credit card kinda sucks, though, but at least they accept it.
author: Sally M.

description:
Very kind waitstaff, clean environment, super affordable, and great food for the price and location. Ordered to go and my food was still piping hot when I sat down to eat. 
(Disclaimer: I am not a ramen connoisseur!)
author: Odalis M.

description:
Good agedashi tofu! 

HORRIBLE RAMEN. I took my left over ramen to go and put it in the fridge. I opened my to go container the next day, and the smell of the soup was like a combination of rotten milk, hot lettuce, and baby diapers. 

DO NOT ORDER RAMEN HERE.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
After my enjoyable experience here, I've decided to come here more often.

(A little side story) i had dinner at the restaurant last night on my own and unfortunately i forgot to bring cash with me. (Credit cards are only for $15 or above) the shop owner is really really nice and she asks me not to worry and I can pay her back next time. She even urges me tht theres no need to rush back when I insisted to come back tomorrow. She is really very nice and hospitable.

Anyway, i came back the next day and i had the vegetable ramen. I needed a break from meat after having meat for a few days in a row. And even though the ramen is all vegetable, there is no deduction in the taste value of the meal!(im a meat eater) the soup, for one, is deliciously flavored with black garlic. There are also many different kinds of veggies in there. Theres tofu for protein, corn, cabbage, seaweed, a black chinese mushroom and onions. All in all, it is a must-have for the vegetarians out there!
author: Josely L.

description:
This is only the second review I've ever written on Yelp because I don't bother unless it's absolutely necessary. 

The only other place I've ever written a review for had a broken piece of a double sided razor blade in their bread so you can imagine, I only do this in extreme cases. 

This place is one of them. 

$15 minimum credit card charge where the average dish costs $7.00. If you don't hit the minimum, they charge you a $2.00 fee.  (In the state of California a $10 minimum is allowed).

The sign that says there is a minimum is at the register, it's handwritten and below eye level, a bit hard to look for but since when do you walk in to a restaurant and look for the credit card minimum right away to determine if you'll eat there or not.

Let's move on to the food. 

It's horrible. I'll probably get sick later today. The rice was cold, the beef smelled strange and I never complain. I tend to love asian and Japanese foods. This was the first place I've ever really hated. 

I'd never eat here again. You shouldn't either. There are several awesome Vietnamese restaurants on the same street as well as another Japanese place a few blocks down. 

Save yourself the disappointment.
author: Sajad G.

description: I'm a ramen newbie so I don't have anything else to compare to.  All I know is that this place have good soup noodles.  The Tonkotsu pork belly is very tender and melts in your mouth,  Usually I don't like pork fat but they are so soft and doesn't taste like pork.  The soup base is rich and milky, very delicious.  Their noodle is very al dente, just the way I like it.  The fry rice is a miss and very disappointed, too salty.  Watch out for the specials, that one time their chicken fry rice have no chicken in them and I ask the waitress and she said its chicken powder!  They used to have a hard boil half egg on top of the noodles but I guess they can't afford to give it away for free, you have to pay addition $ for it.  I like the spiciness of the soup and the seaweed and vegi.
author: Lantz G.

description: Ramen's good but the take out treys are not. Noodles were stuck to the bottom and we had to take out pieces of paper by hand when we pulled the noodles out of it.
author: Asaf N.

description: First off, we walked in and it smelled like there was a gas leak. The service was terrible, our waitress was constantly on her phone and did not serve us any water or tea. I ordered the eel donburi, the eel was very chewy, making it very unappetizing. It was like a rubber band. The shrimp tempura was mainly just batter, and barely had any shrimp. Definitely not satisfied with my experience and will not be coming back.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Came here randomly with 2 friends on a Saturday day. Checked out the menu to see what they had to offer. 
I saw 2 sections for Ramen with one of them being authentic Japanese. And as a no brainer for me, I went for the authentic Japanese ramen and picked the extra spicy tonkatsu ramen. One taste and i was quite pleased with their broth and amount of toppings that came with it - most noticeably the whole (cut in 2) soft boiled egg, most places either give half or none!
My friend enjoyed his ramen so much he ate everything and drink all of the broth. 

It was slow when we got there and the host/waitress was just sitting at the front while on her phone but did make sure we had our water refilled so I didn't mind.  

Definitely coming back for my next Ramen craving
author: Jason L.

description: Prices are good and food taste great! Quick service and attentive waitress.
author: Pj A.

description: Tonkotsu is my go to. The pork is actually extremely tender, flavorful, and fatty. Ramen had a great texture and firmness. Broth was different -- not as savory or garlicky as I'm used to. It's a bit sweet, like theres corn or something. Toppings were a little lacking unless you got extras. All in all, a very satisfying fix.
author: Hill E.

description:
Now, I'm not some ramen-expert, nor do I claim to be. But if its one of those foggy, cold and rainy nights in SF (although we have been lacking rain, but thats another story for another day), and you are on Ocean Ave, and none of the other cuisines (Champa, Jojos, Mings, etc) dont appeal to you, then stop by 21 Taste House.

21 Taste House is one of the places where the name baffles me (21 dishes? 21 drinks? 21 seats?), but I was too hungry to argue.

My husband ordered the Tonkatsu ramen and I had the 1/2 size ramen. The serving size was perfect for the both of us. The broth was was flavourful and the noodles were al dente. For a neighborhood joint that is run by chinese, I can definitely see myself coming back on "one of those nights" (see above for description).
author: Nancie T.

description: This was our first time here and the food and service was great. Their  broth is very tasty and the prices are very reasonable. Will definitely come here again!
author: Joan R.

description: So yummy! Very nice staff! Good prices! I always get the Kimchi Ramen and they are nice enough to make it vegetarian for me, which I thought was super nice bc some places don't accommodate for you like they do. Also loved the mochi ice cream. Will be coming here often! Also loved the decor. Nice colors.
author: jellie d.

description: Pretty great for a local ramen joint... Overall very tastey and great service. Broth is good. Not the best in San Francisco but very good and in the neighborhood!
author: Agnes K.

description:
I came across this place, as it is but a block and a half from my school. With the hopes of getting full off of good Asian food, I was deeply disappointed.

I started off the meal, with water. All I could taste was plastic. So, I ended up ordering their Boba Milk Tea. My thoughts? I can't describe how it taste exactly, but in short terms, I don't like it. At all. The Boba itself? Taste old. Next, I ordered the Korean Style Short Ribs. Putting aside the fact that it's undercooked, they slather it in teriyaki sauce. Probably an attempt to mask the fact that it's mostly fat and undercooked meat. The portions of rice, although portioned heavily, would do much better if they took the time to actually cook it all the way. Oh and the prices? By far, appalling. The portions are low, the prices are high. 

The good thing? Tons of plugs so you can charge your phone and laptop and free wi-fi. That's pretty much it.

Needless to say, I won't be heading here again. EVER.
author: Shilo B.

description: Wow! I was pleasantly surprised how great the ramen was here. The Tonkatsu broth was extremely rich and full of flavor, as Tonkatsu broth is intended to be, yet can oftentimes be lacking flavor and depth. You can really tell they boil the bones for a long time to extract as much flavor as possible. The char siu was surprisingly very good too, generous portion size, and equally as flavorful. Some places don't marinate the char siu, thats not the case here. In some review photos I noticed the egg was overcooked and was concerned it would be, although when we ordered two bowls of ramen, both yolks were gorgeous and runny. I ordered the classic tonkatsu (B1?) and boyfriend had the spicy tan tan. We were both very happy diners and will definitely be making this our new neighborhood go-to for on point ramen.
author: Alexis D.

description: This place looks is nothing fancy from it's looks but the food is super delicious and the prices are great.  The kitchen is a little on the slow side for SF but I think the must not have very much room back there for very many people.  The service is friendly, the ramen is very very tasty.
author: John G.

description: the best ramen resturant where i never have in the Bay Area,  there is the third time for my friends and I to had ramen noodle there. their house special tsukemen ramen was so great. if you like spicy,you can have spicy and choose how spicy for any ramen. their Extertly spicy ramen was a big chanllenge for me but taste sooooo good. yammmy! The price is not so high, usually you can get a ramen in about 8 bounes and a dollar more for the large size. ( a large size ramen is more than enough for me.) Also, you can add a dollar or two dollar more for some side oders, like egg, corn, chashao, vegi or so on.  My favorite iteam in this resturant are chicken teryaki ramen and house special fried rice. verrrrrry goooood! their serving is wondetful, too. highly recommend for everyone, especially for students and the people who got bussy lunch time.
author: Lina W.

description:
This is as authentic as it gets!  I am cantonese, and I absolutely love the food.

First, the chicken / pork / lamb noodle soups are amazing.  There are a lot of ingredients / herbs that you only get with restaurants in China / Asia, not in the US.  And it's really tastey.

Second, the "milk" noodles are also freshly made, not the kind of crap you get in the stores.  I can not believe they charge so little for their food.

In terms of pricing, quality, and authenticity, this place cannot be beat.  This is a more whole in the wall place, so I would go here with friends and family, perhaps not a date.  It gets 5 stars from me.
author: Raymond C.

description:
New restaurant that just opened up in the neighborhood. They primarily serve Chinese style noodle soups, but also have some grilled items and appetizers. 

I came here last week with my roommates, and we each got a noodle soup. I think we were all satisfied. I ordered the beef noodle soup, and it filled the piece of my heart that is reserved for Chinese beef noodle soup. It wasn't quite a perfect bowl of beef noodle soup, but I think it's hard to find a restaurant in SF that does Chinese-style soups so I was happy. If they want to perfect their soup more, i would suggest cooking the beef tendon more -- it was rather tough.

Portions are large and prices are reasonable (~$9 for a large bowl of soup). Server was very nice. I would come again.
author: Wendy S.

description: The ramen is amazing!great little hole in the wall place near ccsf.the prices are lower that most ramen place and very reasonable.I will be black soon!
author: Li C.

description:
My first time coming here wasn't great & I thought I should give it another try. 

Cons:
1. Waited 15 minutes for my drink
2. Asked multiple times when my food was coming
3. Realized they had forgotten my order after 20 minutes
4. Waited 30 minutes for my bowl of noodles
5. Was asked if I was finish within 5 minutes of getting my food

Where's the Pros? No where to be found. 

In addition, they apologized when they were giving me my order saying they were currently busy. I then looked around & saw only two occupied tables. Boy, were they very "busy."
author: Yummy T.

description: i remember the first time i had been there was with my  friends. My friends brought me there and recommend to me the ramen. the ramen is very tasty, i think that is one of best ramen.  The service is also pretty nice.  i would like to recommend this restaurant to my friends.
author: Stephanie L.

description: This place has better ramen than most Japantown ramen spots.  Try the cheese tonkatsu and the pork is very tasty and tender.  The spicy tonkatsu is very rich in flavor and filling.
author: John P.

description:
Pros: prices are reasonable with a good amount of variety of Asian dishes to choose from, portions are generous. 

Cons: they don't take credit card. 

 Came here for lunch with a friend after the lunch hour so when we arrived it was very empty. The staff here was friendly to us. After ordering, I did not wait long for my order came out. I got the grilled pork over rice, with some soup on the side. The grilled pork was tasty and the broccoli and rice was a little lack luster...but that was alright (good thing the tables had soy sauce). 

I would probably go back again.
author: Alex T.

description: Closed early at 9pm. Arrived at 8:50 was told they're closed (?!) Requires cash only or at least $15 minimum. Do not recommend.
author: Clint S.

description:
The sliced roasted pork in the Ramen dishes are tender and flavorful. The service is friendly. No wait to get a table.

I prefer a richer and thicker broth. The cabbage and sprouts made the broth taste more bland.  

p.s. they need to replace the cheap, flexible plastic cups they use to serve water.
author: Johnson B.

description: This ramen was delicious! I wouldn't say it's the best I've had but I'm really stoked that I now live close to a ramen house :) The waitress who waited on me was also quite pleasant and kind. She helped me hold my chopsticks better.  I totally recommend this place, I have no complaints.
author: Rebecca S.

description: What a fantastic place! Tucked away near CCSF, there is never a line but a good selection of ramen so you can get just the flavors/ingredients you want. It's inexpensive and yet as delicious as the overpriced ramen around SF. Highly recommended!
author: Josh R.

description: This place was delicious! We had ramen and the mild truly was mild. We should have ordered medium     The menu is vast and has many options and really well priced. They even do free delivery. We are totally going to go back!
author: Ashley B.

description: I get takeout spicy ramen from here quite frequently, its a good solid rich broth for the miso tonkatsu. Service is quick, and spicy means spicy.
author: Joyo P.

description: as a sf native, this is the best thing to open on ocean ave. veggie and seafood options. why go any where else?
author: Dale L.

description: The ramen here is pretty good but the portions can be a tad underwhelming. Service is generally very nice . Worth a try and i'll be back
author: Anonymous ?.

description: Thanks for the photos, yelpers. I tried it today #704 and it was good! What made it much better was adding/sprinkling the red chili to spice it up! DELISH! I stayed here chatting it up with my friend and the server was very sweet! She didn't rush us at all and I will be back!
author: Sweets N.

description: I loved the house spicy ramen and my girlfriend felt like she was back in japan! Best bowl of soup :)
author: Peter E.

description: This is the BEST ramen in San Francisco. Sshhhhhhhhhhhhhhh don't tell anyone :)
author: Henry D.

description: Back again for at least the sixth or seventh time in the past few months. 21 Taste never disappoints. I took a shot and asked if they ever made anything with bitter melon and the initial answer was no. But the proprietress came out of the kitchen and said she had a bitter melon back there and how did I want it. After a little back and forth on what might be good we settled on a tonkatsu ramen with bitter melon, beef, and black bean sauce. It was off the charts. This has easily become my favorite Asian comfort food place in the City.
author: Lonnie L.

description: Too bad, but I don't think it's worth driving to anymore. Interior doesn't feel clean or comfortable enough. Dining mate found a hair.
author: T. W.

description: I usually eat around City College of San Francisco, and 21 Taste House is one of my favorite choices. I like this restaurant because it has friendly servers, inexpensive food, and different choices of food. The server always smiles when she takes my order. I really like their donburi. I have tried many donburi and ramen and my favorite donburis are Gyu Don and curry chicken rice. The price of each of them is under $9.00. Sometime i would like to order ramen when I am not feeling very hungry. The Tonkatsu Ramen and chicken teriyaki ramen taste good and their prices are lower than donburis need $7.00. However, the size of the ramen is smaller than thr size of the donburi, so I make different order in different situations. Moreover, sometimes they require a long time to make the food when the restaurant is busy, so the customers who are students and need a hurried lunch should not choose to have lunch here.
author: Jinxin H.

description:
Had lunch here twice. I love the fish meat cake (fish tofu) and soft rib bone! Hard to find these dishes in the city. Beef teriyaki was yummy too but a bit too greasy for my liking. Ramen noodle is very chewy like those top ramen places in Bay Area. It has way more ingredients than any other ramen places I tried! Not to mention all the dishes are cheaper than other places serving similar food. 

Waitress was very friendly, services was fast, food was yummy, I'll definitely go back and try other dishes.
author: Y Y.

description: Get the Spicy Tonkatsu (or not spicy if you don't like spice).  It has a lot of flavor, and is a very filing dish!  This place is small but really good.  My only complaint is that they don't have Tsukemen which is my favorite type of ramen.  Also, take note that it is BYOB.
author: Eddie C.

description: Came here today at 3pm and there was no one eating inside. My friend and I decided to try this place out and their menus have typos on it. Service was good though, the waitress checked up on us often but this could be just because we were the only ones there. Seems like a family-owned restaurant. I would come back, but mainly because of the low prices rather than particularly good food. The portions are reasonably sized. A small complaint I have is that my rice noodles were broken up into many pieces instead of being in long strands. CASH ONLY!
author: Cindy L.

description: I have waited for 35 minutes on my meal. The person who come to the restaurant at the same time have checked out and leave already. That's unreasonable. I have only 1 hour for my lunch. They made me really rush to have lunch.
author: Kent W.

description: The waitress doesn't seem to understand English. She brought me the wrong food. It is a tiny little place where I had to stand up a couple of times to let the employee go into the room, which is not so cool when you are in the middle of having your meal. I ordered the fried rice with a slice of pork and fried egg and the food was aweful and bland. I guess the chef forgot to put some salt in the dish. And I saw a customer walk out of the restaurant because he couldn't wait for the waiter to come and take his order; the waiter seemed to forget to pay attention to him. This will be my first and last time visiting to this tiny little restaurant. Very aweful experience.
author: Dennis W.

description: A rice noodle plus Japanese sushi place. When I saw rice noodles I was thinking Yunnanese and southwestern Chinese cuisine, but it turned out not quite as I expected. Not that it was bad -- the flavor was OK -- but it was more of a cross between Cantonese, Vietnamese and Yunnanese. You could sense that it was trying to be a Yunnanese rice noodle place, but isn't quite there yet. If you're not after a specific southwestern Yunnanese kind of flavor, then you might find it to be OK.
author: Chris L.

description: The service is good, always got my water refilled. Food is always in big portions, nothing special though. Taste house is just convenient for me, whenever i get breaks from my classes. Enough said.
author: Cavin T.

description: best ramen i have ever tasted.  so much flavor i can't even explain.  the people working there are super nice!
author: Carter N.

description: The first time I been there with my friends ，both of us ordered Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen，the ramen was tasty. I like the soup. And I would recommend to my friends about this restaurant
author: Eric S.

description: I've been to many different Ramen places in San Francisco and usually they are all a disappointment, surprise right? This ramen place makes each bowl individually with love. It's not the classic pick a broth and add toppings (each for a dollar). All the toppings are included and they give you a large and fulfilling amount. The service is fast and great. We get the same server each time and she always smiles and even remembers our order. It's a little hole in the wall place but by far the best ramen on this side of town.
author: Chanelle W.

description: Decided to give this place a shot today, because I love Ramen. I order the Misc Ramen. I couldn't eat it all, since it was a huge bowl on it. The server came over and said "Was there something wrong?" I said, "No. It's good." No issues about her asking me this. However, this next comment she made was completely rude. The server said, "What's up with this then?" I said, "I am full." First of all, who the heck says this to a customer?! Not everyone eats the same amount. Needless to say, I won't be coming back.
author: Brittany H.

description: I like it. Their rice bowls are big and delicious. The romen is pretty good, definitly a life saver on a cold day. They have free wifi too so I sometimes come for some lunch and hang out on my laptop. They are always realy nice not to mention the fast service. If you want to get in and out of a place that has decently priced good food go here.
author: Jessica J.

description: Very good ramen-- al dente noodles, well-seasoned broth (not too salty), good toppings, and a yummy egg.  Really nice staff, very attentive and hard working.  Great to have a solid ramen place locally.  Every time we've come, we've tried a different ramen, and they've all be really satisfying.
author: C P.
